list.title: Assessments

empty.title: No assessments yet
empty.description: Start your first self-assessment to evaluate compliance with ICAO standards or SMS maturity.

statusDescription.DRAFT: Assessment has been created but not started

typeDescription.GAP_ANALYSIS: Identify gaps between current state and requirements
typeDescription.PRE_REVIEW: Preparation assessment before formal peer review

responseDescription.SATISFACTORY: Evidence confirms compliance with the protocol question requirements
responseDescription.NOT_SATISFACTORY: Evidence indicates non-compliance or insufficient implementation
responseDescription.NOT_APPLICABLE: Protocol question is not applicable to this organization
responseDescription.NOT_REVIEWED: Question has not been reviewed yet

maturityDescription.A: Ad-hoc safety management. No systematic approach.
maturityDescription.B: Safety processes are documented and implemented.
maturityDescription.C: Safety processes are systematically applied and monitored.
maturityDescription.D: Safety performance is measured against targets.
maturityDescription.E: Continuous improvement and predictive safety management.

typeDescription.DOCUMENT: Written documentation such as manuals, plans, or policies
typeDescription.PROCEDURE: Documented procedures, work instructions, or guidelines
typeDescription.RECORD: Records of activities, logs, or audit trails
typeDescription.INTERVIEW: Information gathered through interviews or discussions
typeDescription.OBSERVATION: Direct observation of activities or conditions
typeDescription.OTHER: Other types of evidence not fitting above categories

scoring.eiScoreDescription: Effective Implementation score calculated as percentage of satisfactory questions
scoring.smsMaturityDescription: Overall SMS maturity level based on CANSO Standard of Excellence

validation.incompleteQuestions: {count} questions still need to be answered
validation.missingEvidence: Only {percent}% of questions have supporting evidence

questionnaire.title: Questionnaires
questionnaire.subtitle: Browse USOAP CMA Protocol Questions and CANSO SoE assessments

ans.title: ANS Questionnaire
ans.description: 851 Protocol Questions across 9 audit areas aligned with ICAO standards for Air Navigation Services oversight

sms.title: SMS Questionnaire
sms.description: Safety Management System maturity assessment across 4 components and 12 study areas

info.title: About the Questionnaires
info.ansDescription: The ANS questionnaire is based on ICAO's Universal Safety Oversight Audit Programme (USOAP) Continuous Monitoring Approach. It evaluates State compliance with international standards across 8 Critical Elements.
info.smsDescription: The SMS questionnaire follows CANSO's Standard of Excellence framework to assess Safety Management System maturity. Organizations are rated from Level A (Informal) to Level E (Excellence).

LEG.name: Legislation
LEG.description: Legislation that provides the foundation for safety oversight and the establishment of a civil aviation authority

ORG.name: Organization
ORG.description: Establishment of a civil aviation authority with adequate staffing, resources and organizational structure

PEL.name: Personnel Licensing
PEL.description: Licensing and certification of aviation personnel including pilots, air traffic controllers, and aircraft maintenance engineers

OPS.name: Operations
OPS.description: Operational requirements for aircraft operators including flight operations, cabin safety, and dangerous goods transport

AIR.name: Airworthiness
AIR.description: Certification and continuing airworthiness of aircraft including type certification and maintenance organizations

AIG.name: Accident Investigation
AIG.description: Investigation of aircraft accidents and incidents to determine causes and formulate safety recommendations

ANS.name: Air Navigation Services
ANS.description: Provision of air traffic services, communications, navigation, surveillance, aeronautical information, and meteorology

AGA.name: Aerodromes
AGA.description: Certification and oversight of aerodromes including physical characteristics, visual aids, and rescue and firefighting services

SSP.name: State Safety Programme
SSP.description: Implementation of a State Safety Programme including safety policy, risk management, assurance, and promotion

CE_1.name: Primary Aviation Legislation
CE_1.description: The provision of a comprehensive and effective aviation law consistent with the environment and complexity of the State's aviation activity, and compliant with the requirements of the Convention on International Civil Aviation

CE_2.name: Specific Operating Regulations
CE_2.description: The provision of adequate regulations to address, at a minimum, national requirements emanating from the primary aviation legislation and providing standardized operational procedures, equipment, and infrastructure in conformity with Standards and Recommended Practices

CE_3.name: State System and Functions
CE_3.description: The establishment of a state aviation system and state safety oversight functions to provide, at a minimum, the appropriate organizational structure, qualified technical personnel, defined responsibilities, and documented policies and procedures

CE_4.name: Qualified Technical Personnel
CE_4.description: The availability of adequate and qualified technical personnel for the performance of state safety oversight functions. Technical personnel requirements include staffing, training, competency, and proficiency

CE_5.name: Guidance, Tools and Provision of Safety-critical Information
CE_5.description: The provision of technical guidance, tools, and safety-critical information to the aviation industry, and within the state aviation system, to enable them to meet the established requirements

CE_6.name: Licensing, Certification, Authorization and/or Approval Obligations
CE_6.description: The implementation of processes and procedures to ensure that aviation personnel and organizations meet the established requirements before they are allowed to perform their functions

CE_7.name: Surveillance Obligations
CE_7.description: The implementation of processes, such as inspections, audits, and monitoring activities, to ensure that aviation licence, certificate, authorization, and approval holders continue to meet the established requirements

CE_8.name: Resolution of Safety Issues
CE_8.description: The implementation of processes and procedures to resolve identified safety issues that have an impact on aviation safety, including enforcement measures

SAFETY_POLICY_OBJECTIVES.name: Safety Policy and Objectives
SAFETY_POLICY_OBJECTIVES.description: Management commitment, safety responsibilities, appointment of key safety personnel, SMS documentation, and safety policy communication

SAFETY_RISK_MANAGEMENT.name: Safety Risk Management
SAFETY_RISK_MANAGEMENT.description: Hazard identification, safety risk assessment and mitigation processes

SAFETY_ASSURANCE.name: Safety Assurance
SAFETY_ASSURANCE.description: Safety performance monitoring and measurement, change management, and continuous improvement

SAFETY_PROMOTION.name: Safety Promotion
SAFETY_PROMOTION.description: Training and education, and safety communication

SA_1_1.name: Safety Policy
SA_1_1.description: Management commitment and responsibility for safety, including the safety policy statement

SA_1_2.name: Safety Accountabilities
SA_1_2.description: Identification of the accountable executive and safety responsibilities of managers

SA_1_3.name: Key Safety Personnel
SA_1_3.description: Appointment of key safety personnel including the safety manager

SA_1_4.name: Emergency Response Planning
SA_1_4.description: Coordination of emergency response planning with appropriate organizations

SA_1_5.name: SMS Documentation
SA_1_5.description: SMS implementation plan, documentation, and records management

SA_2_1.name: Hazard Identification
SA_2_1.description: Processes for identifying hazards through reactive, proactive, and predictive methods

SA_2_2.name: Risk Assessment and Mitigation
SA_2_2.description: Safety risk assessment and development of risk controls and mitigation strategies

SA_3_1.name: Safety Performance Monitoring
SA_3_1.description: Monitoring and measurement of safety performance including SPIs and SPTs

SA_3_2.name: Management of Change
SA_3_2.description: Processes to manage safety risks associated with organizational or operational changes

SA_3_3.name: Continuous Improvement
SA_3_3.description: Internal evaluations, audits, and continuous improvement of the SMS

SA_4_1.name: Training and Education
SA_4_1.description: Safety training programs for personnel at all levels

SA_4_2.name: Safety Communication
SA_4_2.description: Communication of safety-critical information and promotion of safety culture

LEVEL_A.name: Informal
LEVEL_A.description: Ad-hoc safety management activities. No systematic approach. Safety may be addressed reactively.

LEVEL_B.name: Defined
LEVEL_B.description: Safety processes are documented and implemented. Basic compliance with regulatory requirements.

LEVEL_C.name: Managed
LEVEL_C.description: Safety processes are systematically applied and monitored. Safety data is collected and analyzed.

LEVEL_D.name: Assured
LEVEL_D.description: Safety performance is measured against targets. Proactive hazard identification and risk management.

LEVEL_E.name: Excellence
LEVEL_E.description: Continuous improvement and predictive safety management. Industry leader in safety culture.

SPM.name: Safety Performance Management
SPM.description: Cross-cutting area addressing how safety performance is measured and managed across all components

HP.name: Human Performance
HP.description: Cross-cutting area addressing human factors and their impact on safety across all components

CI.name: Continuous Improvement
CI.description: Cross-cutting area addressing how continuous improvement is embedded across all components

wizard.pageDescription: Create a new self-assessment to evaluate your organization

questionnaireType.title: Select Questionnaire Type
questionnaireType.description: Choose the framework for your assessment
questionnaireType.helpText: Not sure which to choose? ANS USOAP CMA is recommended for most organizations.

ans.title: ANS USOAP CMA
ans.subtitle: ICAO Universal Safety Oversight Audit Programme
ans.description: Evaluate compliance with ICAO standards across 9 audit areas using the Continuous Monitoring Approach protocol questions.
ans.keyDifference: Best for: Compliance assessment against international aviation safety standards

sms.title: SMS CANSO SoE
sms.subtitle: CANSO Standard of Excellence
sms.description: Assess Safety Management System maturity across 4 components using the CANSO framework with maturity levels A-E.
sms.keyDifference: Best for: SMS maturity assessment and continuous improvement

assessmentType.title: Select Assessment Type
assessmentType.description: What is the purpose of this assessment?

self_assessment.title: Self-Assessment
self_assessment.description: Standard internal evaluation against the selected framework requirements.
self_assessment.bestFor: Initial baseline evaluation and ongoing compliance monitoring

gap_analysis.title: Gap Analysis
gap_analysis.description: Identify gaps between current state and target requirements or maturity levels.
gap_analysis.bestFor: Pre-improvement planning and identifying priority areas

peer_review.title: Peer Review Preparation
peer_review.description: Prepare for an upcoming peer review by completing a thorough self-evaluation.
peer_review.bestFor: Organizations preparing for external peer review

follow_up.title: Follow-up Assessment
follow_up.description: Track progress on previously identified findings and corrective actions.
follow_up.bestFor: Monitoring improvement progress after initial assessment

details.title: Assessment Details
details.description: Configure your assessment scope and timeline
details.titleHint: A clear title helps you identify this assessment later
details.descriptionPlaceholder: Add any notes or objectives for this assessment...
details.dueDateHint: Set a target date to help track progress

scope.ansDescription: Select which ICAO audit areas to include in this assessment
scope.smsDescription: Select which SMS components to assess
scope.noneSelected: No areas selected - please select at least one

review.title: Review & Confirm
review.description: Review your selections before creating the assessment

tips.gather: Gather relevant documentation and evidence before starting
tips.collaborate: Involve key stakeholders from different departments
tips.evidence: Document evidence for each response to support your findings
tips.honest: Be honest in your responses - this assessment is for your improvement

review.confirmLabel: I understand and am ready to create this assessment
review.confirmDescription: By confirming, a new assessment will be created with the settings above. You can begin answering questions immediately or return later.

creating.title: Creating Your Assessment
creating.description: Please wait while we set up your assessment...

success.title: Assessment Created Successfully!
success.description: Your assessment is ready. You can start answering questions now or return later.

errors.createFailed: Failed to create assessment. Please try again.

error.title: Error Loading Assessment
error.description: We couldn't load the assessment. Please try again.

panel.selectQuestion: Select a question from the sidebar to begin
panel.ansInstructions: Select the appropriate response based on your review of the evidence.
panel.smsInstructions: Select the maturity level that best describes your organization's current state.

ansResponse.title: Response
ansResponse.satisfactoryMessage: Evidence confirms compliance with the protocol question requirements.
ansResponse.notSatisfactoryMessage: Evidence indicates non-compliance. Consider documenting findings.
ansResponse.notApplicableMessage: This question is not applicable to your organization.

smsResponse.title: Maturity Level
smsResponse.levelADescription: Ad-hoc safety management. No systematic approach.
smsResponse.levelBDescription: Safety processes are documented and implemented.
smsResponse.levelCDescription: Safety processes are systematically applied and monitored.
smsResponse.levelDDescription: Safety performance is measured against targets.
smsResponse.levelEDescription: Continuous improvement and predictive safety management.

comments.assessorNotesTooltip: These notes will be shared with peer reviewers during the review process. Include any context that would help them understand your response.
comments.assessorNotesPlaceholder: Add notes for reviewers about this response...
comments.internalNotesTooltip: These notes are only visible to your organization's team and will not be shared with peer reviewers.
comments.internalNotesPlaceholder: Add private notes for your team...

tips.title: Tips for Good Notes
tips.tip2: Note any assumptions made in your response

evidence.title: Supporting Evidence
evidence.description: Provide evidence to support your response. Include document references, links, or descriptions.
evidence.descriptionPlaceholder: Describe the evidence supporting your response...
evidence.descriptionHint: Reference specific documents, procedures, or records

B.description: Processes documented but not consistently applied.
